body: Erte's Art Stolen From Brooklyn Deli W hat in the world was the art of Erte doing in the Mill Basin Kosher Deli and Restaurant in Brooklyn? - Erte, the 90-year-old Paris illustrator and designer whose gold lame and hothouse chic suffused Vogue and Harper's Bazaar in the 1920's and for whose latest retrospective New York turned out only last month.
title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY

body: Many years ago the great English player-writer Skid Simon made a very important point: Half a loaf at the bridge table is better than no bread -one should try for the best result possible, and not the best possible result. Simon was thinking of the problems that arise with a weak partner who will not understand scientific bids aimed at determining
title: Bridge: The Half-a-Loaf Principle; Applied in an Unusual Way

body: Players from New York State were among the leaders here this afternoon going into the final two sessions of two major events at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals. Allan Stauber of Poughkeepsie, N.Y., a studious young expert who has had many national successes in the past two years, headed the qualifiers in the Life Master Men's
title: Bridge: Leaders at Fall Nationals Include New York Players

body: Six days a week, just after 6 A.M., the steel doors of the Sanitation Department's Brooklyn-South equipment garage, on an industrial stretch of Georgia Avenue, slide open for a fleet of 47 garbage collection trucks departing for the streets of the southeastern corner of the borough. The vehicles that lumber out of the ancient, lamp-lit garage bound
title: CITY SAYS NEW SANITATION TRUCKS PROVE WORTH

body: For players of some experience, squeezes are commonplace. So are deals on which a defender discards badly in the erroneous belief that he has been squeezed. Somewhere in between, and far rarer, is the genuine ''pseudosqueeze,'' in which a defender has little or no clue to the essential discard. A dramatic example of this play occurred recently at
title: Bridge: Genuine 'Pseudosqueezes' Can Be Tough for Defense

body: For thousands of players gathering here today, this is a beginning: the start of the Summer National Championships, which will continue for 10 days. But for a handful, it is an end. Eight teams survive in the Grand National Team Championship, after local, district and zonal play. The standings in quarterfinal play after 16 of 64 deals were:
title: Bridge: Play in Summer Nationals Beginning in Albuquerque

body: A recent dispute over the appointment of a principal for a Brooklyn elementary school has focused attention on the process of selecting local school administrators under the city's decentralized school system. The naming of Kathleen Shay, a 34-year-old administrator of a remedial-school program, to be principal of Public School 193 in the Midwood
title: PARENTS' ROLE IN HIRING OF PRINCIPAL DISPUTED

body: Most serious tournament players are in favor of having a national championship in their own backyard, for would this greatly reduce their travel and hotel bills. The American Contract Bridge League has long had a policy of staging one of its three annual tournaments in the East, one in the West and one in a central state. This year, for example,
title: Bridge: League Makes a Revision In Choosing Tourney Sites
